lead_paragraph: In Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan Province, the region’s famed cuisine is more popular than ever. But traditionalists worry it’s drowning in spice.

byline.contributor: Adam Wu contributed research from Chengdu, China.

snippet: In Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan Province, the region’s famed cuisine is more popular than ever. But traditionalists worry it’s drowning in spice.
abstract: Chefs of traditional Sichuanese cooking in Chengdu, China, say cuisine has been overcommercialized and degraded due to its rising popularity and rapid global growth; chefs have formed society to restore cuisine’s time-honored ways, and Chinese government has plans to create Michelinlike rating system for Sichuanese restaurants at home and abroad; recipe for San Hua Kao Ji, Three-Flower Roast Chicken, offered.
